Evil Technique Revelation
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Techs/Tech Chains: Evil Technique Revelation
By linkio on Tuesday, August 15, 2000 - 02:42 pm:

The strangest thing just happened. I just combined a good natured Golem/Golem with a good natured Henger/Henger and got a Gobi Golem/Henger. The strange thing is the Gobi had Thwack, I never had this attack before. The Henger was a first generation monster while the Golem was born from 2 Jell/Golem Monsters. Just thought I'd mention this experience.

By torey_luvullo on Tuesday, August 15, 2000 - 04:18 pm:

thats happened to me before too, linkio.

By Foster on Tuesday, August 15, 2000 - 05:01 pm:

yup, it has also happened to me, right now as a matter of fact

l combined a Golem/Naga with a Hare/Naga (which was a "Good" combo, Dadge said,) and I got thwack as well. Both of the previous monsters were good, and had never been trained in bad techniques at all, and it gave me another Golem/Naga

By Petit-Trot on Wednesday, August 16, 2000 - 09:26 am:

Happenned to me too. Combined 2 good monsters, got a good Undine that had a bad tech.

By Phoenix Masta on Wednesday, August 16, 2000 - 05:52 pm:

Well this is just a theory but is it possibly because of the general nature of the sub-breed? Nagas are bad natured yet still that doesn't answer the first one. I think Hengers are neutral and golems are good. Oh well perhaps DP or Nevistar can look into it. be seein' ya

By torey luvullo on Wednesday, August 16, 2000 - 06:12 pm:

i cant remember who did it, but in the last days of the old board, someone put up a table showing what happened when bad was combined with bad, bad with good, etc. i remember also that dark phoenix noted a flaw in the research, that it did not control for type of creature, but that there was promise in continuing this line of research once that loophole was closed. unfortunately, the table and the research, was lost in the scramble of the attack and the move.

and its not only dp or nevistar who can research the game. there are plenty of things you can try, and publish[which is all research is, after all] that dont involve hacking into the game. this might well be one of them.
